page.title: 04A local man of Winford
page.content: Alvis is a big farmer. He owns all the land around us. He keeps pigs, cows, sheep and poultry. He has 32 farms, 200 tractors and employs 300 workers. By the side of the A38 he owns a big farm shop. This is situated about one mile from Bristol Airport. He sells dairy produce and meat. The Womens Institute supplies him with honey, jam, bread and fruit. When I went to his slaughter house I saw the method used to "process" the cows: Workers put an electric shock through it to kill it and then put it in boiling water to get rid of the hairs. To get the blood out they slit its neck. Finally they remove the leather and put it on a trailer to make slippers with wool inside, or aprons to sell and use at the farms.
